what: resmush: Optimize and Compress Image Files with 'reSmush.it' — resmush-package
title: resmush: Optimize and Compress Image Files with 'reSmush.it' — resmush-package
text: Compress local online images using 'reSmush.' API service https://resmush./.

title: resmush: Optimize and Compress Image Files with 'reSmush.it' — resmush-package
Optimize a local file — resmush_file
text: Optimize local images using reSmush.API. Note default parameters function outfile = file overwrites local file. See Examples.

title: Optimize a local file — resmush_file
code: resmush_file(   file,   outfile = file,   qlty = 92,   verbose = FALSE,   exif_preserve = FALSE )

title: Optimize a local file — resmush_file
text: file Path paths local files. reSmush can optimize following image files: png jpg gif bmp tif outfile Path paths optimized files store disk. default, override file specified file. length file parameter. qlty affects jpg files. Integer 0 100 indicating optimization level. optimal results use vales 90. verbose Logical. TRUE displays summary results. exif_preserve Logical. Exif information () deleted? Default remove (.e. exif_preserve = FALSE).

title: Optimize a local file — resmush_file
text: Writes disk optimized file API call successful. case, (invisibly) data frame summary process returned well. value vector outfile duplicated, resmush_file() rename output suffix _1. _2, etc.

title: Optimize a local file — resmush_file
code: # \donttest{ png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")  # For the example, write to a temp file tmp_png <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")  resmush_file(png_file, outfile = tmp_png)  # Several paths jpg_file <- system.file("extimg/example.jpg", package = "resmush") tmp_jpg <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg")   summary <- resmush_file(c(png_file, jpg_file), outfile = c(   tmp_png,   tmp_jpg ))  # Returns an (invisible) data frame with a summary of the process summary #>                                         src_img #> 1 D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.png #> 2 D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.jpg #>                                                               dest_img src_size #> 1 C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/file1bec19712aa1.png 239.9 Kb #> 2 C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/file1bec1c377a74.jpg 100.4 Kb #>   dest_size compress_ratio notes #> 1   70.7 Kb          70.5% OK ;) #> 2   83.2 Kb          17.2% OK ;)   # With parameters  # Silently returns a data frame resmush_file(jpg_file, outfile = tmp_jpg, verbose = TRUE) #> ✔ Optimizing D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.jpg: #> ℹ Effective compression ratio: 17.2% #> ℹ Current size: 83.2 Kb (was 100.4 Kb) #> ℹ Output: C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/file1bec1c377a74.jpg resmush_file(jpg_file, outfile = tmp_jpg, verbose = TRUE, qlty = 10) #> ✔ Optimizing D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.jpg: #> ℹ Effective compression ratio: 93.6% #> ℹ Current size: 6.4 Kb (was 100.4 Kb) #> ℹ Output: C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/file1bec1c377a74.jpg # }

title: Optimize an online file — resmush_url
text: Optimize download online image using reSmush.API.

title: Optimize an online file — resmush_url
code: resmush_url(   url,   outfile = file.path(tempdir(), basename(url)),   qlty = 92,   verbose = FALSE,   exif_preserve = FALSE )

title: Optimize an online file — resmush_url
text: url url vector urls pointing hosted image files. reSmush can optimize following image files: png jpg gif bmp tif outfile Path paths optimized files store disk. default, temporary files (see tempfile()) basename() file provided url created. length url parameter. qlty affects jpg files. Integer 0 100 indicating optimization level. optimal results use vales 90. verbose Logical. TRUE displays summary results. exif_preserve Logical. Exif information () deleted? Default remove (.e. exif_preserve = FALSE).

title: Optimize an online file — resmush_url
text: Writes disk optimized file API call successful. case, (invisibly) data frame summary process returned well. value vector outfile duplicated, resmush_url() rename output suffix _1. _2, etc.

title: Optimize an online file — resmush_url
code: # \donttest{  # Base url base_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst/"  png_url <- paste0(base_url, "/extimg/example.png") resmush_url(png_url)  # Several urls jpg_url <- paste0(base_url, "/extimg/example.jpg")   summary <- resmush_url(c(png_url, jpg_url))  # Returns an (invisible) data frame with a summary of the process summary #>                                                                              src_img #> 1 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.png #> 2 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.jpg #>                                                      dest_img src_size #> 1 C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/example.png 239.9 Kb #> 2 C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/example.jpg 100.4 Kb #>   dest_size compress_ratio notes #> 1   70.7 Kb          70.5% OK ;) #> 2   83.2 Kb          17.2% OK ;)  # Use with jpg and parameters resmush_url(jpg_url, verbose = TRUE) #> ✔ Optimizing https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.jpg: #> ℹ Effective compression ratio: 17.2% #> ℹ Current size: 83.2 Kb (was 100.4 Kb) #> ℹ Output: C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/example.jpg resmush_url(jpg_url, verbose = TRUE, qlty = 10) #> ✔ Optimizing https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.jpg: #> ℹ Effective compression ratio: 93.6% #> ℹ Current size: 6.4 Kb (was 100.4 Kb) #> ℹ Output: C:/Users/RUNNER~1/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpuEVjyf/example.jpg # }
